intro: Linosyris lineata, commonly known as the narrowleaf linosyris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Linosyris lineata is typically found in dry, rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
